content: This is sort of hard core sci-fi fiction. The sort of fiction where we can make believe in our heads a dreamy future that’s impossible, but perhaps tantalising to believe that it could be. Sorry, Joshua, but we have fouled our own nest so badly and we are now in the 11th hour and have barely managed to get a handful of people living in cramped quarters just barely above our stratosphere and we’ve exausted most of our own planet’s most accessible resources. But I do like science fiction stories.
